definition: lit. to beg grandpa and call on grandma (idiom)/fig. to go about begging for help
pinyin: qiu2 ye2 ye5 gao4 nai3 nai5

sentences.english: The old house was soon crowded with relatives and Grandpa's friends.
sentences.chinese: 老屋里很快挤满了亲戚和爷爷的朋友。

sentences.english: Papa would bring an old battered coal shovel and an old-fashioned ice chest with him.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷总会带来一把破旧的煤铲和一台老式冰柜。

sentences.english: My grandfather is a master story-teller.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷是个讲故事的高手。

sentences.english: As long as grandpa's grandmother be on the hoof, they would assurance father be also deathless .
sentences.chinese: 只要爷爷奶奶活着，他们会保证爸爸也不死。

sentences.english: Grandpa got his horticulturalist certificate when he was 20.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷20岁的时候就考到园艺师证书了。

sentences.english: The new law also still gives rights of guardianship entirely to fathers and grandfathers.
sentences.chinese: 在新法规中父亲和爷爷依然保持着监护权。

sentences.english: Today, my grandpa who is staying with us mistook me for a Japanese soldier and started to hit me with a bat.
sentences.chinese: 今天来家里住的爷爷把我当成了日本鬼子用球棒打我。

sentences.english: Our granddaddies swung on them nooses . Our grandmamas swung on them nooses .
sentences.chinese: 我们的爷爷奶奶们悬挂在绳套上。

sentences.english: Grandpa threw back his head and laughed. Amusement danced in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷仰着头大笑起来，眼神里满是得意之情。

sentences.english: But Grandpa did not want to work at Soba restaurant anymore.
sentences.chinese: 不过老爷爷不想再在荞麦面馆工作了。

sentences.english: Grandpa reads newspapers and books everyday.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷每天都要读书看报。

sentences.english: I wanted everyone to tell Grandpa Simon what we loved about him.
sentences.chinese: 我希望大家能说说大家为什么喜欢西蒙爷爷。

sentences.english: GrandmaGrandpa still planted their garden every spring.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶和爷爷仍然每年春天都耕种花园。

sentences.english: The first frost always meant that Papa was coming to see us.
sentences.chinese: 第一次霜降总是意味着爷爷来探望我们。

sentences.english: Here you are, Nicola. Do you like them? Yes , Grandad.
sentences.chinese: 给你，尼古拉。你喜欢它们吗？是的，爷爷。

definition: (informal) grandma (paternal grandmother)/(respectful) mistress of the house/CL:位[wei4]/(coll.) boobies/breasts
polite term for old woman or man
father's younger brother/uncle/Taiwan pr. [shu2 shu5]/CL:個|个[ge4]

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
